Package pls.expression

A simple, light-weight, high performance, expression parser and evaluator.

The Expression library provides classes for parsing and evaluating expressions involving number, strings, functions and arithmetic operators. It has no dependencies, provides support for named parameter values (via an expression context), includes a number of built in math and string functions, and can be extended with custom functions and operators. The primary API entry point for the library is the Parser class.

Embedding the expression parser into an application can be done with just a few lines of code: 


   import pls.expression.ExpressionContext;
   import pls.expression.Parser;

   ...

   String expression = "3.1415 + 2 * cos(theta)";
   ExpressionContext context = new ExpressionContext();

   ...

   new Parser().parse(expression).eval(context);
Note that for simplicity and performance, the Expression library does not use a formal BNF grammer parser - instead it uses a simplified approach to splitting out the components of an expression, and recursion to handle construction of the appropriate expression tree for evaluation according to operator precedence.

The Expression library is thread safe. The Parser, as well as the resulting Expression tree instances used for evaluation may be used concurrently across multiple threads.

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    ArithmeticOperator.ArithmeticOperationF
    Lambda interface used to implement arithmetic operations on floating point values
    ArithmeticOperator.ArithmeticOperationI
    Lambda interface used to implement arithmetic operations on integer values
    BinaryOperator.BinaryOperation
    Interface for lambda functions or classes that implement binary operators.
    Expression
    The primary expression interface.
    Function0
    Lambda interface used to implement a functional expression which takes a no arguments.
    Function1
    Lambda interface used to implement a functional expression which takes a single argument.
    Function2
    Lambda interface used to implement a functional expression which takes two arguments.
    RelationalOperator.RelationalOperation
    Interface for lambda functions that implement relational operators.
    UnaryOperator.UnaryOperation
    Interface for lambda functions that implement unary operators.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    ArithmeticOperator
    Utility class for implementing arithmetic type operators.
    BinaryOperator
    Base class used for binary operators (operators that take two operands).
    Constant
    Expression element representing a constant value.
    ContextValue
    Expression to retrieve a value from the expression context.
    ExpressionContext
    Context used during the evaluation of an expression.
    Factory
    Class used to register named functions or operators.
    Functions
    Provides basic sets of functions that can be registered (if desired).
    List
    Expression element representing a list value.
    NamedExpression
    Base class used to represent nodes in an expression tree that are named.
    Operators
    Useful utility methods for a number of default unary, binary, and relational expression operators.
    Parenthesis
    Expression element representing a parenthesis containing a sub-expression.
    Parser
    The expression parser.
    RelationalOperator
    Base class for relational (comparison) type operators.
    TokenStream
    Supports the parsing of tokens from an expression.
    UnaryOperator
    Base class used for simple unary operators.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    Parser.TokenType
    Private enumeration used by the parser to represent the type of an expression token.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    ExpressionError
    Error class used to report failures in the parsing or processing of an expression.
